responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: jQuery 1.4.2 suffers from DOM XSS in the 'load' function.
    analysis: |
      The `load` function in jQuery 1.4.2 is vulnerable to DOM XSS. When loading HTML from a remote URL, the function directly injects the response into the DOM without proper sanitization.
      If the response contains user-controlled data, an attacker can inject malicious JavaScript code, which will be executed in the context of the vulnerable application.
    cwe: CWE-79
    function_names:
      - load
    filenames:
      - example/public/jquery.js
    classification: very promising
```

leads.headline: jQuery 1.4.2 suffers from DOM XSS in the 'load' function.
leads.analysis:
The load function in jQuery 1.4.2 is vulnerable to DOM XSS. When loading HTML from a remote URL, the function directly injects the response into the DOM without proper sanitization.
If the response contains user-controlled data, an attacker can inject malicious JavaScript code, which will be executed in the context of the vulnerable application.
